page.title: 04Ladock River 1
page.content: Ladock River has two branches. One branch rises on Trefullock Moor and flows past Brighton Cross and through New Mills to join the other branch just east of Ladock. This branch flows from Mitchell through Arrallas and Ladock Woods. West of Ladock it becomes Tresillian river which runs past St.Clements to join the Truro River at Malpas. This in turn joins the River Fal and then flows into the sea at Falmouth. By the Parish Hall we dropped a piece of wood into the water and it floated down river. It took 2 minutes and 10 seconds to go 27 paces. At the bridge by the chapel Irwin dropped a stick into the water from the left arch on the bridge. It took 1 minute 41 seconds. At Arrallas bridge it took 51 seconds. We found out that the flow gets slower as it goes down river.
